org.xchain.framework.security

Interface IdentityService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultIdentityService

    public interface IdentityService
extends java.io.Serializable
    The IdentityService defines a pluggable way to retrieve Identitys. Applications who want a strategy different than the DefaultIdentityService should create their own service and preempt the default with their own @ThreadStartStep and @ThreadStopStep annotated methods.
    Author:
    Jason Rose, Christian Trimble

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Identity getIdentity()
      Retrieves the currently authenticated Identity.
      void loggedIn(java.security.Principal principal)
      Stores the Identity for the already-authenticated Principal.
      void loggedOut()
      Flushes the authenticated Identity.

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentity

        Identity getIdentity()
        Retrieves the currently authenticated Identity.
        Returns:
        The authenticated Identity.

      • loggedIn

        void loggedIn(java.security.Principal principal)
              throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Stores the Identity for the already-authenticated Principal. Use getIdentity() to retrieve it.
        Parameters:
        principal - A unique identifier for an Identity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if there is a problem with the Identity retrieval.

      • loggedOut

        void loggedOut()
        Flushes the authenticated Identity.
